parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>MP Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> [[Image:Boundingbox.jpg|right|200px]] Returns a raw bounding box of given object in model coordinates space. This command is similar to [[boundingBox]] but gives more precise measurements.<br>
An alternative syntax was introduced with <template><title>arma3</title></template> v1.92 allowing to specify clipping type to be used, which in some cases could make bounding boxes even more precise. The output of both syntaxes was also extended to include bounding sphere diameter, identical to [[sizeOf]] return value. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[boundingBoxReal]] object </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - the extreme points of the model in format [[PositionRelative]], as well as bounding box sphere diameter, to format [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[xmin, ymin, zmin],[xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter]. </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> clippingType [[boundingBoxReal]] object </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> clippingType: [[Number]] - can be one of:
* 0 - ClipVisual (could significantly reduce the size of bounding boxes on buildings)
* 1 - ClipShadow
* 2 - ClipGeometry
* 3 - ClipGeneral (same type that is used in main syntax) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Array]] - the extreme points of the model in format [[PositionRelative]], as well as bounding box sphere diameter, to format [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[xmin, ymin, zmin],[xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter]. </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_bbr = [[boundingBoxReal]] [[vehicle]] [[player]];
_p1 = _bbr [[select]] 0;
_p2 = _bbr [[select]] 1;
_maxWidth = [[abs]] ((_p2 [[select]] 0) - (_p1 [[select]] 0));
_maxLength = [[abs]] ((_p2 [[select]] 1) - (_p1 [[select]] 1));
_maxHeight = [[abs]] ((_p2 [[select]] 2) - (_p1 [[select]] 2));
</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[hint]] [[str]] (0 [[boundingBoxReal]] [[cursorObject]]);</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[boundingBox]], [[sizeOf]], [[boundingCenter]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>
